de.frauas.jdemandmodel.seed

Class Seed

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.frauas.jdemandmodel.seed.Seed

  • public class Seed
extends java.lang.Object
    This class takes care of the seeds. Note that one seed is actually a list of many seeds - namely all system nano times when RandomUtil was used during the simulation. Therefore, when using a seed (setting active true and calling the "loadSeeds" method) it must be ensured, that the simulation procedure will be exactly the same as it was when the seed was saved. Otherwise, the simulation result will NOT be the same. Similarly, when using a command line interface the same arguments should be parsed.
    Author:
    lukas

    • Constructor Detail

      • Seed

        public Seed()

    • Method Detail

      • setActive

        public static void setActive(boolean setActive)
        Activates the seed. This method should be called before or after loading a seed, as the seed will only be used if active equals true. In the same way active should be set false (default) before starting the simulation procedure if no seed should be used / a seed should be saved.
        Parameters:
        setActive - set true if an existing seed should be used, else set false (default)

      • isActive

        public static boolean isActive()
        Returns:
        true, if a seed is active (there's a seed to be used), otherwise false

      • writeToFile

        public static void writeToFile(java.lang.String filename,
                               java.lang.String[] args)
        This method saves a seed at the relative path "seeds/< filename >.seed" with the used arguments (command line interface) added in the first line. Those arguments can be read when the file is loaded. If no CLI is used, an empty string array can be passed.
        Parameters:
        filename - the seed file will be saved under this name
        args - the command line arguments/options
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • loadSeeds

        public static java.lang.String[] loadSeeds(java.lang.String filename)
        This method loads a seed from the file with the given filename. The file is expected to contain one line with possible command line options/arguments and a list with as many seeds as will be needed for the simulation process.
        Parameters:
        filename - filename of the file of the seeds that should be used
        Returns:
        an array of arguments (command line).

      • setSeed

        public static void setSeed(java.util.Random random)
        This method should be called whenever a randomly generated variable is used in the program, so either the seed used for it can be saved or a given seed can be loaded in case Seed is set active.
        Parameters:
        random - the Random instance of which the seed is to be set
